page.title: 01Farmland to N.E. of Alnwick
page.content: This area is a plateau 100m above S.L. along the western edge descending to around 60m in the east with some higher ground (much quarried in past where the whin sill outcrops. The land is used almost entirely for agriculture and appears neat and efficiently farmed. Large tenanted farms rear and fatten cattle and sheep and grow cereals, chiefly barley and potatoes. The farms are worked by farmers and their families with rarely more than one employed worker in addition The population more than one empployed worker in addition. The population is sparse, centers upon the farm holdings, the total adult population on 1985 electoral register is 64. Though the main east coast railway runs through the east of the block, public transport is limited to
